idea-plugin.name: MockkHttp
idea-plugin.description:
Network Traffic Interceptor for Android Development

Capture and inspect HTTP/HTTPS traffic from your Android applications using OkHttp interceptors. Perfect for debugging, testing, and understanding your app's network behavior.

Key Features:

  • Zero-Config Interception: Automatically injects interceptor via Gradle plugin - no code changes needed
  • Real-Time Traffic Inspection: View all HTTP requests and responses as they happen
  • Mock Rule Management: Create and apply mock responses for API testing
  • Export/Import Flows: Save captured traffic as JSON for documentation or sharing
  • Debug Build Only: Interceptor is automatically excluded from release builds
  • Failsafe Design: Gracefully falls back if plugin server is not running

Setup (2 Steps):

  1. Add the Gradle plugin to your app's build.gradle.kts
  2. Add the interceptor dependency (debug only)

See the Help tab in the tool window for detailed setup instructions.

Requirements:

  • Android app using OkHttp (Retrofit uses OkHttp internally)
  • Android emulator or device
  • Gradle plugin version 7.0+ recommended

Use Cases:

  • Debug network issues in your app
  • Test error handling by mocking server errors
  • Inspect API responses without backend access
  • Document API contracts for your team
  • Test offline scenarios and edge cases

Note: This tool is designed for development and testing purposes only. The interceptor only works in debug builds and has minimal performance impact.
